description: In this course, students consider the modern age in light of their Enduring Questions experience.
Topics include artists and authors from the twentieth century to the present, such as Freud,
Picasso, Woolf, Arendt, and Borges, addressing topics such as the rise of nationalism, rejections
of colonialism, globalization, migration, and race and racism. Students identify and evaluate
their own ethical views in relation to ethical theories, like consequentialism and virtue ethics,
encountered throughout the Enduring Questions program. Offered annually in the spring semester.
